channel.title: Comments on: An Interview with Michael Fishbane
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Yonatan
item.dc:creator: Yonatan
item.description:
Prof. Fishbane appears to create a very subjective and personal Judaism.
How does the State of Israel, the Holocaust, the North American Jewish Federation model, collective Jewish history, Catholic Israel, or Jewish Peoplehood fit into his theology?

item.title: By: Berry Schwartz
item.dc:creator: Berry Schwartz
item.description: Very interesting. His book was a wonderful read. The problem is that there is no data on how real people in the real world can use this in a healthy, authentic and soulful way.

item.title: By: lawrence kaplan
item.dc:creator: lawrence kaplan
item.description:
I have a few questions.
1. Professor Fishbane speaks of God's transcendence. What of His immanence?
2: He further speaks of the study of the Bible, of Scripture, as fostering diverse forms of God consciousness. What of the study of the Talmud, the central form of traditional Jewish study?
3:Finally, he speaks of the Adamic-self and the Mosaic-self. What of the Abrahamic self?
